info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 8:15PM MST until June 28 at 10:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE FLAG BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 815 PM MST, Emergency management reported flash flooding from the Flag Burn Scar in the Hualapai Mountain Park and along Hualapai Mountain Road near Pine Lake. Heavy rain has ended though between 1 and 2 inches of rainfall was recorded by automated sensors in the area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Flag Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Flag Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hualapai Mountain Park and Hualapai Mountain Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Flag Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
